boardgame.name: Ginkgopolis
boardgame.description: 2212: Ginkgo Biloba, the oldest and strongest tree in the world, has become the symbol of a new method for building cities in symbiosis with nature. Humans have exhausted the resources that the Earth offered them, and humanity must now develop cities that maintain a delicate balance between resource production and consumption. Habitable space is scarce, however, and mankind must now face the challenge of building ever upwards. To develop this new type of city, you will gather a team of experts around you, and try to become the best urban planner for Ginkgopolis._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In Ginkgopolis, the city tiles come in three colors: yellow, which provides victory points; red, which provides resources; and blue, which provides new city tiles. Some tiles start in play, and they're surrounded by letter markers that show where new tiles can be placed._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;On a turn, each player chooses a card from his hand simultaneously. Players reveal these cards, adding new tiles to the border of the city in the appropriate location or placing tiles on top of existing tiles. Each card in your hand that you don't play is passed on to your left-hand neighbor, so keep in mind how your play might set up theirs!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;When you add a new tile to the city, you take a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;power_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; card of the same color, and these cards provide you additional abilities during the game, allowing you to scale up your building and point-scoring efforts._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2013 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Multi-player Nominee

New in shrink, pristine condition. If you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re interested in a bundle with the expansion: _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Ginkgopolis: The Experts_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;, shoot me an offer for the pair! This little feller has become part of the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;collect less, play more_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; philosophy that_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s now the law in my game room. Here_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s the simple way I decided which of my old friends to keep and which to pass along to a new happy home. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve been bringing a few extra _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;surprise_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; games to my weekly pre-planned game night (for the last six months or so) to see if anyone would be interested in trying them. The ones that changed our plans and got played still live on my game shelves, the ones that didn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t are now yours to play and love. It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s becoming ever more difficult lately to negotiate the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;menu_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; for my current group_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s weekly get-together, and since we evolved as a group by mutual agreement on the type of games we enjoy playing (for the most part!), I want to avoid creating any irreconcilable differences that would lead to a break-up! $13.50 for shipping in USPS flat rate box. Thanks, take care,,,
